                           java.lang.String itemPrice)

        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item
        itemPrice - the price of the item
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if strings are empty

      • orderFood

                      java.lang.String amount)
               throws InvalidInputException
        Places an order for a certain menu item.
        Parameters:
        item - the menu item to be ordered
        amount - the amount of units to be ordered
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if the menu item or amount is not selected or if amount is not positive integer

      • getPopularItems

        public java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.FoodItem> getPopularItems()
        Gets the 5 most popular items on the menu. Sorts them by amount sold.
        Returns:
        an List that contains the 5 most popular items

      • createSupply

        public void createSupply(java.lang.String supplyName)
                  throws InvalidInputException
        Adds a new supply to the supply list. Each supply has a user-defined name and a count. By default, the count of a supply is 0, and it is up to the user to instantiate its initial quantity.
        Parameters:
        supplyName - name of the food supply to be added
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if string is empty or if it is a duplicate

      • editSupplyQuantity

        public void editSupplyQuantity(ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.Supply supply,
                               java.lang.String count)
                        throws InvalidInputException
        Sets the quantity of an existing food supply in the inventory.

        A value under 0 will give the command to delete the item entirely.

        Parameters:
        supply - food supply whose quantity is to be edited
        count - quantity to be set
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if count is not a valid integer

      • createEquipment

        public void createEquipment(java.lang.String equipmentName)
                     throws InvalidInputException
        Adds a new equipment to the equipment list. Each piece of equipment has a user-defined name and a count. By default, the count of an equipment is 0, and it is up to the user to instantiate its initial quantity.
        Parameters:
        equipmentName - name of equipment to add
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if string is empty

      • editEquipmentQuantity

        public void editEquipmentQuantity(ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.Equipment equipment,
                                  java.lang.String count)
                           throws InvalidInputException
        Sets the quantity of an existing equipment in the inventory.

        A value under 0 will give the command to delete the item entirely.

        Parameters:
        equipment - equipment whose quantity is to be edited
        count - quantity to be set
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if count is not a valid integer

      • createEmployee

        public void createEmployee(java.lang.String employeeName,
                           java.lang.String role,
                           java.lang.String salary)
                    throws InvalidInputException
        Adds an employee to the database.
        Parameters:
        employeeName - name of the employee we want to add
        role - their role within the company
        salary - how much money they earn per hour
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if strings are null or empty or if salary is not a valid hourly wage

                    throws InvalidInputException
        Fires an employee.
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee to be fired
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if an employee isn't selected

      • createShift

        public void createShift(ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.Employee employee,
                        java.lang.String day,
                        java.sql.Time startTime,
                        java.sql.Time endTime)
                 throws InvalidInputException
        Schedules a shift for an employee.
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee that we are scheduling
        day - the day of the week of the shift
        startTime - the start time of the shift
        endTime - the end time of the shift
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if shift times are invalid or if day is not selected

      • cancelShift

        public void cancelShift(ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.Employee employee,
                        ca.mcgill.ecse321.foodtruck.model.Shift shift)
                 throws InvalidInputException
        Removes a shift for an employee.
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee for whom we want to remove the shift
        shift - the shift to be removed
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if there is no employee or shift selected
